tags: also how did they get so many kids who look that much alike
summary: Can we talk for a sec about how all the girls who play the Thénardier sisters in the new Les Mis adaptation make perfect...
body:
Can we talk for a sec about how all the girls who play the Thénardier sisters in the new Les Mis adaptation make perfect fancasts for Sansa and Arya? Like, look at Erin Kellyman and Alex Jarrett:

But like not just that, we also have them as babies growing up in Winterfell, in Sienna Barnes and Amani Johnson:

And we’ve got them at AGoT ages too (or maybe a touch younger) in Tiarna Williams and Isabelle Lewis:

Basically I’m just sad there isn’t more footage of the two of them together (or Azelma at all, frankly) because you can bet I’d be making tons of content with them.

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: Hold on. GRRM said the Night King was a  allegory for climate change. He also says Arya will kill the Night King in his books...
body: Hold on. GRRM said the Night King was a allegory for climate change. He also says Arya will kill the Night King in his books too. No One killed the Night King. No One can end Climate Change alone. Okay. I see you Martin. Hopefully those books come out more fleshed out than that season 🙄🙄🙄

blog.name: the-wolfofstormsend
blog.title: rich girl. assassin. top.
blog.description: I write fics about Gendrya. If you like lots of random Gendrya prompts and headcanons this is the tumblr for you.

tags: this is my contribution to society
body:
Gendrya prompt: #90000028364 aka Forgie Edition

I love how most of the Gendrya fam has decided that Forgie is a girl with Gendry’s eyes but I can’t stop laughing over the idea that their first child can totally wield a sword like Arya but prefers Gendry’s weapon.

Could you just imagine tiny little four year old Forgie dragging around a little practice war hammer? And Gendry teasing Arya that her Septa was wrong and their little girl is going to be the one with blacksmith hands. Arya being fine with it because their children are going to be the deadliest kids in Westeros and between Gendry and Arya the kids are going to have access to every weapon and know how to use them.

blog.name: bonesgadh
blog.title: Another Arya Stark Stan
blog.description: Just a girl who is obsessed with many things: Star Wars, Game of Thrones, Harry Potter, Bones, Pitch Perfect, La La Land, Desperate Housewives, Stranger Things, Friends, HIMYM, Orange Is The New Black, The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel, The Hunger Games. Cheese addict. Dog lover. Disney and Pixar crazy fan. Pretty decent cook. 🇲🇽. Proud Gryffindor. Broadway Freak. Drummer. I write stuff, mostly fanfiction. Rey Solo theorist. I love all sports. Main ships: Booth & Brennan, Gendrya, Ross & Rachel, Jeca, Everlark, Merder, Mileven, Damerey, Harmione. I have a slightly unhealthy obsession with Julie Andrews and I love John Williams beyond all things. Current state: waiting for Stranger Things 3.

summary: Unhinged Chapter 5, a game of thrones fanfic | FanFiction
title: Unhinged Chapter 5, a game of thrones fanfic | FanFiction
description:
Winter is harsh and unforgiving. Sweden is at war. For nine months, Gendry has been working maintenance at a manor turned research clinic. There’s bombings every day, supplies grow scarce and the building is falling apart. Entirely Gendry POV Originally a tumblr ficlet because I wanted Gendry to have a pet ferret. Modern Arya/Gendry
 @oqueequesentes-borboletas

tags: thank you for pointing this out dear anon
summary: Isn't it weird that Gendry x Arya shippers use weirwood in their fics when it's Jaqarya symbol?
question: Isn't it weird that Gendry x Arya shippers use weirwood in their fics when it's Jaqarya symbol?
answer:
Dear anon, I think everyone is entitled to include whatever they wish in their fanfics. George R. R. Martin would strongly disagree but let’s be honest, we love his characters too much to stop writing about them. Perhaps one day his Lordship will lock us all in the black cells…Until then let everyone write whatever they want to.

It is a pity that the asoiaf fandom often fails to notice the symbolism of weirwood in Arya and Jaqen relationship. I blame us, Jaqaryans. Gendrya fandom are very diligent in analyzing every detail of Gendry and Arya interactions. They are often wrong in their interpretations, the saddest example I’ve seen was an essay based on the notion that Arya and Gendry are the incarnations of Ice and Fire. How disappointed they must feel now. However, they keep on writing. They devote their time to their ship. We don’t do that much for our Jaqarya. Perhaps it is because the show let so many of us down, changing Jaqen and Arya dynamics in season 5. Still, the show also confirmed that Gendrya is not canon. They made us brave again. Let’s celebrate and keep on writing.

xoxo

blog.name: mizznancywheeler
blog.title: sin verguenza
blog.description: Debbie. OG Arya Stark Stan. Been about that Gendrya life since 2012. Ao3: thesunflowermachine. I like memes. Reconsider trying me.

summary: You know it’s not subverting the Éowyn archetype and those who embody the spirit that archetype in a lot of ways like Arya Stark...
body:
You know it’s not subverting the Éowyn archetype and those who embody the spirit that archetype in a lot of ways like Arya Stark to paint them as too revolutionary, must be sent to create a whole new world for their own good.

Why? Because the feminist critique against Eowyn’s fate isn’t why doesn’t she fuck off after Middle Earth is saved or why doesn’t she create a new world of other women that we the readers never get to see? It’s why doesn’t Éowyn get the same stature and importance that the male characters receive as saviors of the universe? It’s unfair that she’s seemingly relegated to the liner notes as wife and mother. I can also see why people find that a rewarding end for her yes, but it can’t be denied that there’s an imbalance between Éowyn and the men heroes at the end of the trilogy. And it’s probably because Tolkien thought that was a fitting, righteous end for a woman.

So, yeah, I don’t think it’s some great subversion that Arya was sent off from Westeros despite having first hand experience of all the horrors forced upon the small folk of Westeros. How many of the other prominent members of nobility aside from Gendry can say that they know what Arya’ seen or been through what she has? And Gendry was largely kept mute in the dragon pit. Arya has the empathy, the drive, the passion to make a difference in the new world of Westeros…but instead it has to be focused on West of Westeros because GRRM can only keep his women dead or isolated from larger power structures in his new world where the likes of Tyrion and Bronn act as proxy kings. Look at how it came down at the end. Dany was murdered. Cersei died. Margaery and Olenna Tyrell were murdered. Asha/Yara and Sansa remain in isolated states away from the majority of Westeros. Brienne spends her life in service to King Bran’s reign. The women of Dorne are largely dead it seems. Where are the prominent women for most of Westeros? In the end, Arya is rendered as small as Eowyn but painting it is an adventure doesn’t make that less sexist.

Brienne spends her life in service to King Bran’s reign. The women of Dorne are largely dead it seems. Where are the prominent women for most of Westeros? I can also see why people find that a rewarding end for her yes, but it can’t be denied that there’s an imbalance between Éowyn and the men heroes at the end of the trilogy. And it’s probably because Tolkien thought that was a fitting, righteous end for a woman.

So, yeah, I don’t think it’s some great subversion that Arya was sent off from Westeros despite having first hand experience of all the horrors forced upon the small folk of Westeros. How many of the other prominent members of nobility aside from Gendry can say that they know what Arya’ seen or been through what she has? And Gendry was largely kept mute in the dragon pit. Arya has the empathy, the drive, the passion to make a difference in the new world of Westeros…but instead it has to be focused on West of Westeros because GRRM can only keep his women dead or isolated from larger power structures in his new world where the likes of Tyrion and Bronn act as proxy kings. Look at how it came down at the end. Dany was murdered. Cersei died. Margaery and Olenna Tyrell were murdered. Asha/Yara and Sansa remain in isolated states away from the majority of Westeros. Brienne spends her life in service to King Bran’s reign. The women of Dorne are largely dead it seems. Where are the prominent women for most of Westeros? In the end, Arya is rendered as small as Eowyn but painting it is an adventure doesn’t make that less sexist.
